content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = Tuple{String, String}[]
    current_block = ""
    in_code_block = false

    for line in split(md, "\n")
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            if !isempty(current_block)
                push!(code_blocks, (current_block, "julia"))
                current_block = ""
            end
            in_code_block = true
        elseif startswith(line, "```")
            if !isempty(current_block)
                push!(code_blocks, (current_block, ""))
            end
            in_code_block = false
        elseif in_code_block
            current_block *= line * "\n"
        end
    end

    if !isempty(current_block)
        push!(code_blocks, (current_block, ""))
    end

    julia_code = join([block for (block, lang) in code_blocks if lang == "julia"], "\n\n")
    return julia_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` representing a markdown document as input. It iterates over each line of the document and extracts the code blocks enclosed between triple backticks (```). If the code block is preceded by `julia`, it is considered a Julia code block. The code blocks are collected in a tuple of (code_block, language), where `language` is "julia" for Julia code blocks and an empty string for others. Finally, all the Julia code blocks are joined with a newline separator and returned as a string.
